name: Biryani
short_description: Originating from the Mughal Empire, fragrant biryani features fluffy basmati rice layered with marinated meat or vegetables, all infused with aromatic spices and slow-cooked to perfection.

name: Pilaf
short_description: Steeped in ancient Persian tradition, pilaf features fragrant rice simmered in seasoned broth, often enriched with tender meat, vibrant vegetables, and sweet dried fruits for a harmonious blend of flavors.

name: Kuku
short_description: Originating from Iran, this hearty dish combines eggs with vibrant herbs, vegetables, and spices, creating a flavorful, dense treat. Often enjoyed as a comforting meal, it’s a beloved staple in Persian cuisine.

name: Chelo kabab
short_description: Steamed saffron basmati rice pairs perfectly with succulent skewers of seasoned ground lamb or beef in this beloved Iranian classic. Accompanied by grilled tomatoes and a pat of butter, it’s a fragrant, flavorful feast.

name: Kabab koobideh
short_description: Originating from Iran, kabab koobideh features a savory blend of ground beef and lamb mixed with grated onion and spices. Grilled to perfection on skewers, it delivers a smoky, tender bite full of rich flavor.

name: Halva
short_description: Originating from medieval Persia, halva delights with its rich, nutty flavors and melt-in-your-mouth texture. Made with finely ground grains or nuts and sweetened to perfection, it’s a beloved treat that captures the essence of Iranian sweets.

name: Jujeh kabab
short_description: Tender chicken pieces marinate in a fragrant blend of yogurt, saffron, and lemon juice, then grill to perfection over hot coals. A beloved staple of Iranian cuisine, Jujeh kabab captivates with its smoky, zesty flavor.

name: Abgoosht
short_description: Originating from Iran, this hearty slow-cooked stew blends tender mutton and lamb with chickpeas, white beans, and potatoes, creating a rich, flavorful broth that warms the soul.

name: Khoresh
short_description: Slow-cooked to perfection, Khoresh blends tender meat, vibrant vegetables, and fragrant spices, creating a rich, hearty stew that embodies the essence of Persian cuisine. Traditionally served with fluffy rice, it delights the senses and warms the soul.

name: Khoresh gheimeh
short_description: A savory Iranian stew blends tender lamb and beef with yellow split peas and tangy dried limes, creating a rich flavor profile. Crowned with crispy fried potato sticks, it’s a cherished comfort food.

name: Lavash
short_description: Originating from the rich culinary traditions of Western Asia, lavash features a delightful blend of wheat flour and yeast, producing a soft, slightly chewy flatbread. Its warm, rustic flavor makes it perfect for wrapping savory meats or scooping up dips.

name: Zulbia
short_description: Delicate coils of fermented batter are deep-fried to golden perfection and drenched in a fragrant sugar syrup. A beloved Persian treat, zulbia offers a delightful balance of sweetness and crunch.

name: Ash
short_description: Hearty and comforting, this Iranian soup blends tender noodles, vibrant vegetables, and aromatic herbs, simmered to perfection. A staple of Persian culture, it warms both body and soul.

name: Ghormeh sabzi
short_description: A beloved staple of Iranian cuisine, this fragrant herb stew melds tender lamb and beef with kidney beans and zesty black lemon. Its rich flavors and vibrant greens create a comforting, hearty dish.

name: Kateh
short_description: Originating from Iran, this simple rice preparation combines basmati with vegetable oil and salt for a soft, slightly sticky texture. Perfectly comforting, it serves as a staple base for flavorful stews.

name: Zereshk polow
short_description: Saffron-infused basmati rice is beautifully layered with tart red barberries in this traditional Iranian dish. Often paired with succulent chicken, it offers a delightful balance of flavors and a taste of Persian hospitality.

name: Bastani sonnati
short_description: Saffron-infused and delightfully creamy, Bastani sonnati features rich flavors of salep, cardamom, and crunchy pistachios. A beloved Iranian treat, it captures the essence of Persian tradition in every scoop.

name: Kabab barg
short_description: Thinly sliced marinated lamb or beef, Kabab barg captures the essence of Iranian cuisine with its smoky, charred flavor. Grilled to perfection, it's a tender delight often enjoyed at festive gatherings.

name: Tahchin
short_description: Fragrant saffron rice melds with creamy yogurt and tender chicken in this traditional Iranian delight, baked to perfection for a golden, crispy crust. A savory masterpiece of Persian cuisine.

name: Sholeh zard
short_description: A vibrant Persian rice pudding, Sholeh zard delights with its golden hue and fragrant blend of saffron, rosewater, and cardamom. Traditionally served during celebrations, it’s a sweet taste of Iranian culture.

name: Morgh-e shekam por
short_description: A whole chicken is lovingly stuffed with a fragrant blend of spiced rice, dried fruits, and crunchy almonds, creating a festive centerpiece in Iranian cuisine that celebrates tradition and flavor.

name: Kashk-e bademjan
short_description: Mashed roasted eggplant mingles with tangy kashk, sautéed onions, and garlic, creating a rich and flavorful Persian dip. A staple of Iranian cuisine, it embodies warmth and tradition in every bite.

name: Sabzi khordan
short_description: An essential part of Persian cuisine, this vibrant platter features crisp radish, scallions, and a fragrant mix of fresh herbs like basil, mint, and dill, offering a refreshing crunch with every bite.

name: Tahdig
short_description: Crispy and golden, the beloved tahdig emerges from the pot as the crowning glory of Persian rice dishes. This iconic Iranian technique elevates simple grains into a flavorful, crunchy delight.
